question: Compute our net exposure if the US raises Section 301 tariffs on HS 8538.90 from 25% to 35% effective next month. We have an undelivered PO for 12,000 units of AR-PCB-X1 with a CIF customs value of $50 per unit. Apply the contract’s tariff adjustment, thresholds and caps. Who pays what and can we cancel?
expected_answer:
Buyer pays the new 35% duty at import and owes a price increase to Seller equal to the 10% duty delta × customs value, subject to the 3% threshold and 8% annual cap; cancellation of undelivered POs is allowed if no agreement in 30 days.

Details:
{
  "who_bears_tariff": "Buyer (Importer-of-Record under Section 8.1)",
  "incoterm": "FOB Shanghai (Buyer arranges import)",
  "policy_citations": [
    "Section 8",
    "Section 9",
    "Schedule A (HS 8538.90 baseline 25%)"
  ],
  "calculations": {
    "tariff_old_rate": 0.25,
    "tariff_new_rate": 0.35,
    "tariff_delta_rate": 0.1,
    "customs_value_per_unit_usd": 50.0,
    "units": 12000,
    "price_adjustment_per_unit_usd": 5.0,
    "price_adjustment_total_usd": 60000.0,
    "landed_cost_delta_pct": 0.1,
    "threshold_triggered_(>3%)": true,
    "annual_cap_pct": 0.08,
    "cap_applied": false
  },
  "exposure_breakdown": {
    "duty_paid_at_border_usd": 210000.0,
    "incremental_duty_vs_baseline_usd": 59999.99999999999,
    "contract_price_adjustment_usd": 60000.0
  },
  "rights_and_remedies": {
    "repricing_window": "good-faith adjustment per Section 9",
    "cancel_pos_if_no_agreement_30_days": true
  },
  "assumptions": [
    "Customs value equals CIF $50 as stated.",
    "Current year cap headroom > 8% not exceeded."
  ]
}

metadata.title: International Master Supply Agreement (Electronics Components)
metadata.tariff_adjustment_policy: Section 9 Tariff Adjustment formula; threshold 3%; annual cap 8% per product family. Buyer pays import duties (Section 8).
metadata.baseline_duty_and_hs_reference: Schedule A lists HS codes and baseline US duty rates for Chinese-origin goods.

reference_contexts:
8.1 Buyer shall be responsible for all import duties, tariffs, customs brokerage, harbor fees and VAT/GST assessed on importation into the United States or the country of destination.
8.2 As of the Effective Date, baseline tariff information for each Product/HS code is recorded in **Schedule A** ("**Baseline Duty Rate**") solely for adjustment calculations under Section 9.

9.1 If a Change in Law modifies the tariff or similar import charge applicable to a Product of Chinese origin, the parties agree to adjust pricing for undelivered quantities as follows:
**Tariff Adjustment = (New Duty Rate − Baseline Duty Rate) × Customs Value per unit.**
9.2 No adjustment applies if the change results in a landed‑cost delta of less than **3%** for the affected Product.
9.3 Aggregate adjustments under this Section are capped at **8%** of the annual spend per Product family.
9.4 If the parties cannot agree within thirty (30) days, Buyer may cancel undelivered POs for the affected Products without penalty.

| SKU | Description | HS Code | Country of Origin | Baseline Duty Rate (US) | Base Unit Price (USD) |
|---|---|---|---|---:|---:|
| AR‑PCB‑X1 | Control PCB assembly | 8538.90 | CN | 25% | 42.00 |
| AR‑IC‑M4 | Microcontroller module | 8542.31 | CN | 25% | 11.50 |
| AR‑HSG‑K7 | Aluminum housing | 7616.99 | CN | 10% | 7.20 |

**Customs Value Basis:** CIF at US port (for adjustment math only).

question: If the US reduces tariffs on HS 8542.31 from 25% to 10% for Chinese origin, what price change applies to AR-IC-M4 for undelivered quantities with CIF $30/unit? Estimate the decrease and state who benefits.
expected_answer:
Price decreases by the 15% duty delta × customs value for undelivered units; Buyer still pays the reduced 10% duty at import.

Details:
{
  "who_bears_tariff": "Buyer (Section 8) pays 10% instead of 25%.",
  "policy_citations": [
    "Section 8",
    "Section 9",
    "Schedule A (HS 8542.31 baseline 25%)"
  ],
  "calculations": {
    "tariff_old_rate": 0.25,
    "tariff_new_rate": 0.1,
    "tariff_delta_rate": -0.15,
    "customs_value_per_unit_usd": 30.0,
    "price_adjustment_per_unit_usd": -4.5,
    "beneficiary": "Buyer (lower invoice price + lower duty)",
    "threshold_triggered_(>3%)": true,
    "cap_applied": false
  }
}

question: EU imposes a retaliatory tariff that raises the composite duty on HS 9026.20 by +9% for three consecutive months. What remedies are available and who bears the duty?

metadata.title: EMEA Distribution Agreement (Medical Devices)
metadata.tariff_adjustment_policy: Section 7: repricing if composite duty increase ≥8% for 3 consecutive months; else forecast reduction up to 30% or termination of line; Section 6: Distributor bears duties, tariffs and VAT.
metadata.baseline_duty_and_hs_reference: Schedule A lists HS codes and baseline EU duty rates for US-origin products.

reference_contexts:
6.1 Distributor is **Importer‑of‑Record** and responsible for all import duties, tariffs (including any EU retaliatory or safeguard duties), customs brokerage and VAT in the Territory.
6.2 Baseline EU duty rates for each HS code are recorded in **Schedule A** for analytics and benchmarking purposes only.

7.1 If a Change in Law introduces or increases tariffs applicable to US‑origin Products in the Territory resulting in a **composite duty increase ≥ 8%** for three (3) consecutive calendar months, either party may request good‑faith repricing.
7.2 If no agreement is reached within thirty (30) days, Distributor may reduce its twelve‑month forecast by up to **30%** without penalty, or Supplier may terminate the affected Product line upon sixty (60) days’ notice.

question: India imposes an anti-dumping duty of 15% on HS 7007.19, raising composite duty from the 10% Baseline Composite Duty to 25%. For an undelivered order of 20,000 m² of GLT-SG-3.2 at CIF $8.10/m², compute Buyer’s incremental duty and whether repricing/cancellation rights apply.
expected_answer:
Incremental duty = 15% × $8.10 × 20,000 = $24,300. The composite increase (>12% over baseline) triggers Section 6.2; Buyer may request repricing or cancel open POs for the affected Products with 15 days’ notice.

Details:
{
  "calculations": {
    "baseline_composite_duty": 0.1,
    "new_composite_duty": 0.25,
    "increase_vs_baseline": 0.15,
    "cif_per_m2_usd": 8.1,
    "qty_m2": 20000,
    "incremental_duty_usd": 24299.999999999996
  },
  "who_bears_tariff": "Buyer (IOR)",
  "policy_citations": [
    "Section 5.1",
    "Section 6.1-6.3",
    "Schedule A"
  ]
}

metadata.title: Purchase Agreement (Solar Glass) - CIF India
metadata.tariff_adjustment_policy: Section 6: Buyer bears anti-dumping/safeguard duties; repricing/cancellation if composite duty increases >12% above Baseline Composite Duty in Schedule A.
metadata.baseline_duty_and_hs_reference: Schedule A contains HS 7007.19 items with baseline composite duty 10-12%.

reference_contexts:
5.1 Buyer is **Importer‑of‑Record** and responsible for Basic Customs Duty, Social Welfare Surcharge and IGST, and any safeguard or anti‑dumping duty.
5.2 Baseline Indian duty for each HS code is captured in **Schedule A** for reference.

6.1 If India imposes or increases an **anti‑dumping** or **safeguard duty** on the Products’ HS codes or origin (PRC), Buyer shall bear such duties on importation.
6.2 If the composite duty (including anti‑dumping/safeguard) increases by **more than 12%** above the **Baseline Composite Duty** stated in Schedule A, Buyer may (a) request repricing for undelivered quantities; or (b) cancel open POs for the affected Products with fifteen (15) days’ notice.
6.3 For repricing, the adjustment equals the incremental duty multiplied by the applicable Customs Value.

| SKU | Description | HS Code | Origin | Baseline Composite Duty (IN) | Base Price (USD/m²) |
|---|---|---|---|---:|---:|
| GLT‑SG‑3.2 | 3.2 mm tempered solar glass | 7007.19 | CN | 10% | 8.10 |
| GLT‑SG‑4.0 | 4.0 mm tempered solar glass | 7007.19 | CN | 10% | 9.20 |
| GLT‑ARC‑3.2 | 3.2 mm AR‑coated glass | 7007.19 | CN | 12% | 9.90 |

**Incoterm:** CIF Nhava Sheva, Incoterms 2020.
**Importer‑of‑Record:** Buyer.

| GLT‑SG‑4.0 | 4.0 mm tempered solar glass | 7007.19 | CN | 10% | 9.20 |

question: Can Buyer refuse to pay anti-dumping duty under this Agreement?

metadata.title: Purchase Agreement (Solar Glass) - CIF India
metadata.tariff_adjustment_policy: Section 6: Buyer bears anti-dumping/safeguard duties; repricing/cancellation if composite duty increases >12% above Baseline Composite Duty in Schedule A.
metadata.baseline_duty_and_hs_reference: Schedule A contains HS 7007.19 items with baseline composite duty 10-12%.

reference_contexts:
5.1 Buyer is **Importer‑of‑Record** and responsible for Basic Customs Duty, Social Welfare Surcharge and IGST, and any safeguard or anti‑dumping duty.
5.2 Baseline Indian duty for each HS code is captured in **Schedule A** for reference.

6.1 If India imposes or increases an **anti‑dumping** or **safeguard duty** on the Products’ HS codes or origin (PRC), Buyer shall bear such duties on importation.
6.2 If the composite duty (including anti‑dumping/safeguard) increases by **more than 12%** above the **Baseline Composite Duty** stated in Schedule A, Buyer may (a) request repricing for undelivered quantities; or (b) cancel open POs for the affected Products with fifteen (15) days’ notice.
6.3 For repricing, the adjustment equals the incremental duty multiplied by the applicable Customs Value.

question: UK introduces a 7% tariff on HS 1509.10 (olive oil) where Baseline UK Duty is 0%. For a call-off of 40,000 L at a DDP unit price of £5.60, what price increase can Seller request and can Buyer refuse?
expected_answer:
Seller’s landed cost increase is 7% of Customs Value. Section 6.1 permits passing through the incremental duty since >5%. However, Buyer may reject increases exceeding 6% in a rolling 12 months and cancel undelivered orders.

Details:
{
  "calculations": {
    "baseline_duty_pct": 0.0,
    "new_duty_pct": 0.07,
    "increase_pct": 0.07,
    "ddp_unit_price_gbp": 5.6,
    "indicative_increment_per_unit_gbp": 0.392,
    "threshold_(>5%)": true,
    "buyer_reject_if_>6%": true
  },
  "who_bears_tariff": "Seller (IOR under DDP) initially; economic pass-through per contract limits.",
  "policy_citations": [
    "Section 4.1-4.2",
    "Section 6.1-6.3",
    "Schedule A"
  ]
}

metadata.title: UK Framework Procurement Agreement (Packaged Foods)
metadata.tariff_adjustment_policy: Section 6: Seller may request price increase if new UK tariffs raise landed cost by >5% vs Baseline Duty; Buyer may reject increases >6% in rolling 12 months and cancel; decreases must be passed through.
metadata.baseline_duty_and_hs_reference: Schedule A lists HS codes and baseline UK duty (0%) for ES-origin foods.

reference_contexts:
4.1 Seller is **Importer‑of‑Record** for deliveries into the UK.
4.2 Seller will perform customs clearance and pay any applicable UK import duties, VAT (if applicable) and fees.

6.1 If the UK introduces new or increased tariffs or tariff‑rate quotas applicable to the Products that increase Seller’s landed cost by more than **5%** relative to the **Baseline Duty** in Schedule A, Seller may request a price increase equal to the incremental duty applied to the Customs Value.
6.2 Buyer may reject any increase exceeding **6%** in a rolling twelve‑month period and cancel undelivered orders for the affected Products without penalty.
6.3 Any decrease in applicable tariffs will be passed through to Buyer effective on the implementation date.

| SKU | Description | HS Code | Origin | Baseline UK Duty | DDP Price (GBP) |
|---|---|---|---|---:|---:|
| SE‑PASTA‑500 | Durum wheat pasta (500 g) | 1902.19 | ES | 0% | 1.10 |
| SE‑SAUCE‑TOM | Tomato sauce (glass jar) | 2103.20 | ES | 0% | 0.95 |
| SE‑OLIVE‑EVOO | Extra virgin olive oil (1 L) | 1509.10 | ES | 0% | 5.60 |

**Incoterm:** DDP Manchester, Incoterms 2020.
**Importer‑of‑Record:** Seller.

question: The US adds a 10% tariff on EU-origin sewing machines (HS 8452.10) and a 5% surcharge on control cabinets (HS 8537.10). Compute the maximum pass-through Seller can invoice this year if the total contract price is $478,000 and neither line has shipped.

metadata.title: Equipment Purchase Agreement (Industrial Sewing Lines)
metadata.tariff_adjustment_policy: Section 6: Seller may pass through incremental US tariffs on EU-origin equipment; annual pass-through cap 5% of total contract; evidence required. Section 5: Seller pays duties as IOR.
metadata.baseline_duty_and_hs_reference: Schedule A includes HS 8452.10 and 8537.10 with baseline US duty ~2.5-2.7%.

reference_contexts:
5.1 Seller is **Importer‑of‑Record** and responsible for US import duties, tariffs and customs fees on EU‑origin Equipment.
5.2 Baseline US duty rates are recorded in Schedule A for reference.

6.1 If the United States imposes new or increased tariffs on EU‑origin machinery applicable to the Equipment after the Effective Date, Seller may **pass through** the incremental duty amount for undelivered Equipment, calculated as:
**Tariff Pass‑Through = (New Duty Rate − Baseline Duty Rate) × Customs Value.**
6.2 Annual pass‑throughs are capped at **5%** of the total contract price.
6.3 Seller will provide documentary evidence (entry summaries) supporting any claimed pass‑through.

| Line | Description | HS Code | Origin | Baseline US Duty | Price (USD) |
|---|---|---|---|---:|---:|
| Line‑A | Automated sewing line (8 heads) | 8452.10 | IT | 2.5% | 420,000 |
| Line‑B | Control cabinet and PLC | 8537.10 | IT | 2.7% | 58,000 |

**Incoterm:** DDP New York, Incoterms 2020.
**Importer‑of‑Record:** Seller.
